{"id":754775946,"lang":"cpp","time":"1Â month","timestamp":1658602379,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"66 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/754775946/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Add Two Numbers","memory":"71.5 MB","code":"/**\n * Definition for singly-linked list.\n * struct ListNode {\n *     int val;\n *     ListNode *next;\n *     ListNode() : val(0), next(nullptr) {}\n *     ListNode(int x) : val(x), next(nullptr) {}\n *     ListNode(int x, ListNode *next) : val(x), next(next) {}\n * };\n */\nclass Solution {\npublic:\n    ListNode* addTwoNumbers(ListNode* l1, ListNode* l2) {\n        ListNode* dummy = new ListNode(-1);\n        ListNode* cur ;\n        cur = dummy ;\n        int carry{0};\n        int sum {0};\n        while(l1!=NULL || l2!=NULL){\n            int x1 = l1!=NULL ? l1->val :0;\n            int x2 = l2!=NULL ? l2->val :0;\n            sum = (x1+x2+carry)%10;\n            carry = (carry+x1+x2)/10;\n            \n            cur->next = new ListNode(sum);\n            cur = cur->next ;\n            \n            if(l1!=NULL)\n                l1 = l1->next;\n            if(l2!=NULL)\n                l2 = l2->next;\n        }\n        if(carry!=0)\n            cur->next = new ListNode(carry);\n        return dummy->next ;\n    }\n};","compare_result":"","title_slug":"add-two-numbers"}
